result.execSummary:
The defendant Jasmine I Ray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Veh. Use-Control. Substance, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(am).
  • Homicide by Veh. Use-Control. Substance, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $500.00 payable to Milwaukee County Health and Human Services, $6,146.00 payable to daughter of victim Darrell T., Darneisha T., and $14,054.00 payable to the daughter of victim Terry J., Domineq C.

Provide a DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge. Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges. Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges including the restitution surcharges be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
Concurrent with: Count 2; credit for 310 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
- Successfully complete a school program to enhance ability to obtain gainful employment.
- Successfully complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain gainful employment.

- Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
- Successfully complete a parenting class.
- Cooperate and participate with a Mental Health Evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.

- Cooperate and participate with an AODA treatment and follow any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Defendant not to drive any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Count 1; credit for 310 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jasmine I Ray

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING  Transcript (44 pages) commencing 11/04/2016 received and filed. DA

Defendant Jasmine I Ray in court with attorney Gary Raymond George.  Defendant Jasmine I Ray in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by victim's family of Terry J:  Monica T., Shemikqua C., and Vianca F.  More additional statements made by defendant's mother, Mary B.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 25 YEARS, concurrent to Count #2.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 15 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS.
Credit given for 310 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2 (AMENDED):  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 25 YEARS, concurrent to Count #1.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 15 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS.
Credit given for 310 days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 - AMENDED):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* Successfully complete a parenting class.
* Successfully complete a school program to enhance ability to obtain gainful employment.
* Successfully complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain gainful employment.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $500.00 payable to Milwaukee County Health and Human Services.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $6,146.00 payable to the daughter of victim Darrell T., Darneisha T.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $14,054.00 payable to the daughter of victim Terry J., Domineq C.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered defendant's driver operating privileges REVOKED for a period of 5 years.
* Court ordered defendant not to drive any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Filed:
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Jasmine I Ray in court with attorney Gary Raymond George.  Defendant Jasmine I Ray in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State filed an Amended Information today.
Arraignment held.
Defense counsel waived reading of the "Amended Information" and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 AMENDED to:  Homicide by Intoxicated Use of a Vehicle (Detectable Amount of Controlled Substance) [a Class D FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 940.09(1)(am), 939.50(3)(d).  
Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #2 AMENDED to:  Homicide by Intoxicated Use of a Vehicle (Detectable Amount of Controlled Substance) [a Class D FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 940.09(1)(am), 939.50(3)(d).  

Count #3 is deleted.

Court examined defendant as to her right to an NGI special plea.  Court finds that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waived her right to a special plea.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 (AMENDED):  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Case adjourned to 11-04-2016 at 10:00 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

filed by ADA Antoni Apollo on behalf of the State.  
Count #1 is AMENDED to:  Homicide by Intoxicated Use of a Vehicle (Detectable Amount of Controlled Substance) [a Class D FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 940.09(1)(am), 939.50(3)(d).  
Count #2 is AMENDED to:  Homicide by Intoxicated Use of a Vehicle (Detectable Amount of Controlled Substance) [a Class D FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 940.09(1)(am), 939.50(3)(d).  
Count #3 is deleted.

Defendant Jasmine I Ray in court with attorney Gary Raymond George.  Defendant Jasmine I Ray in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for return on 2 doctor reports; competency and NGI.

The competency report concludes that the defendant is competent to proceed.
No challenges to the competency report.
Court finds defendant is competent to proceed and REINSTATES the proceedings today.

The NGI report does NOT support an NGI plea.
Defense challenged the NGI report and requests a 2nd opinion.
Court GRANTS request and ordered defendant to submit to a 2nd NGI evaluation under Milwaukee County pay due within 30 days.

Case adjourned to 07-21-2016 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Return on Doctor's 2nd NGI Report.

Matter before the Court for Doctor's Report Return as to competency and ngi plea.  Hearing proceeded.
Parties in receipt of reports dated 4-28-16 and 5-05-16 authored by Dr. Deborah Collins opining the defendant competent and no support as to special plea.  As to competency, the defendant believes she is incompetent; defense requests competency hearing.
The Court to address issue of ngi plea after competency issue resolved.  Wisconsin Forensic Unit contacted via telephone for the purpose of scheduling.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 10:30 am.
NGI Report as to the defendant prepared by psychologist, Dr. Deborah Collins; filed.

Attorney Gary George in court, defendant Jasmine I Ray not in court, in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Statements made.

Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed.
Court SUSPENDED the proceedings.
Court ordered defendant to submit to a competency evaluation AND an NGI evaluation with Wisconsin Forensic Unit pursuant to Wisc. stats.  971.16 and 971.14(2).  No specific doctor requested, however, the same doctor is to do both evaluations. 

Parties stipulate to waive time limits.

**Bail remains the same.

Case adjourned to 05-16-2016 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Return on Doctor's Competency AND NGI Reports.

Defendant Jasmine I Ray in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Jasmine I Ray in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jasmine I Ray in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Jasmine I Ray in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
